bug.author: HenryKenlay
bug.summary: Error when using `dgl.data.TUDataset` in the latest versions
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
I get an error when using dgl.data.TUDataset in dgl versions 0.5.0 and 0.5.1. I also get the same error if I build from source. <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
I've used ENZYMES in this example but it seems to be an issue across all the datasets. Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
(Optional) Delete cached data rm -rf ~/.dgl/ENZYMES ~/.dgl/ENZYMES.zip Inside a python 3.7 virtualenv pip install dgl torch torchvision Import TUDataset from dgl.data import TUDataset Try and create an object TUDataset('ENZYMES')
The stack trace is as follows <denchmark-code>(venv) kenlay@Henry-2:~/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack$ python Python 3.7.6 (default, Jan 8 2020, 13:42:34) [Clang 4.0.1 (tags/RELEASE_401/final)] :: Anaconda, Inc. on darwin Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information. >>> from dgl.data import TUDataset Using backend: pytorch >>> TUDataset('ENZYMES') /Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/data/utils.py:31: UserWarning: Pandas is not installed, now using numpy.loadtxt to load data, which could be extremely slow. Accelerate by installing pandas warnings.warn("Pandas is not installed, now using numpy.loadtxt to load data, " Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/data/tu.py", line 288, in __init__ verbose=verbose) File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/data/dgl_dataset.py", line 284, in __init__ verbose=verbose) File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/data/dgl_dataset.py", line 91, in __init__ self._load() File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/data/dgl_dataset.py", line 175, in _load self.process() File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/data/tu.py", line 326, in process getattr(g, field_name[0])[field_name[1]] = data File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/view.py", line 81, in __setitem__ self._graph._set_n_repr(self._ntid, self._nodes, {key : val}) File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/heterograph.py", line 3753, in _set_n_repr if F.context(val) != self.device: File "/Users/kenlay/Dropbox/DPhil/research/graph-attack/venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dgl/backend/pytorch/tensor.py", line 76, in context return input.device AttributeError: 'numpy.ndarray' object has no attribute 'device' </denchmark-code>
Note that installing pandas doesn't fix the issue. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behaviour</denchmark-h>
Have an object returned: <dgl.data.tu.TUDataset object at 0x7fddfc527750> <denchmark-h:h2>Environment</denchmark-h>
DGL Version (e.g., 1.0): 0.5.0, 0.5.1, installed from source Backend Library & Version (e.g., PyTorch 0.4.1, MXNet/Gluon 1.3): Pytorch 1.6.0 OS (e.g., Linux): MacOS Catalina 10.15.5 How you installed DGL (conda, pip, source): pip Build command you used (if compiling from source): MacOS instructions given here Python version: 3.7.6 CUDA/cuDNN version (if applicable): N/A (cpu version) GPU models and configuration (e.g. V100): N/A Any other relevant information: N/A
<denchmark-h:h2>Comment</denchmark-h>
This class works for me if I downgrade to 0.4.3. Note that if I use the class in 0.4.3 and then try and load the cached data in 0.5.1 I get the same error. I can try to dig into the source code to identify the issue if this is a bug that others can reproduce.
